topic.title: HPE Helion Public Cloud Identity Services v3 API

p.i: If you are using the v2 Identity Services API, click here for those API references.

section.title: 1. Overview
section.p: The HPE Helion Identity Service exposes the OpenStack Keystone V3 API specification. Specifically, it supports token and credential based operations. A few things to note about the HPE Identity Service are:

ul.li: Token created via v2 API can be validated via v3 API
Token created via v3 API can be validated via v2 API.
v3 token can be created via HPE User access key pair.
HPE Helion Identity service will return a service catalog upon token response that only includes services and endpoints for which the token may be used.
Support for request and response in xml format.
Introduction of rate limiting.

section.p: We will be referring to HPE Helion Public Cloud Identity Services in this document as simply Identity or the Identity service.

row.entry: Submitted changes for Token, Project API documentation.
Submitted changes for Version and updates for Token and Project API documentation.
Submitted updates to Token, Version and Project API documentation.
Submitted updates to Token API documentation.
Submitted updates to Credential API documentation.
Submitted updates to Project API documentation.
Submitted updates for Token API documentation.

section.title: 2.1 Accounts
section.p: Each user has an account. Every user belongs to a single domain. Groups can be used to group users. Projects are resource collections and user is assoicated with one or more projects via roles. The terms 'project' and 'tenant' are used interchangeably.

section.title: 2.2 Regions and Availability Zones
section.p: The Identity Service is currently available in two regions which can be accessed via standard RESTful clients. As HPE Helion Public Cloud accounts are global, either region can be used for conducting identity operations. Choose the region closest to you for improved performance.

section.title: 2.3 Service Catalog
section.p: The service catalog provides the service information with its region specific endpoints. Returned service endpoint depends on token scoping and user roles associated with a project. The interface in endpoint data indicates if that endpoint is in public, beta or preview release state.

The service catalog is returned as part of create and validate token operations. When an unscoped token is requested, the service catalog contains only global service endpoints ( e.g. identity). When a project scoped token is requested, the service catalog contains the services and endpoints for which the token may be used when interacting. If a service or endpoint is not present in the service catalog, it typically means that either the service has not been activated or the user does not have the appropriate roles defined that grant them access for the service on the given project

ol.li: Content-Type : Denotes the request content type. Supported Content-Types are application/xml and application/json
Accept : Denotes the response content type that the caller can understand. Supported Content-Types are application/xml and application/json. Default type is application/json
X-Auth-Token : Contains authentication token of the user who is invoking the REST API
X-Subject-Token : This is used only in token operations. Token operations such as DELETE/HEAD/GET are done against the value in this header
Content-Type : Denotes the response content type. Supported Content-Types are application/xml and application/json.
X-Subject-Token : This is used only in token operations. Users token is returned via this header

section.title: 3.4.1 Credentials
section.p: Credentials are user authentication credentials. A user may have up to three (3) active credentials at a time. An HTTP code 403 will be returned if an operation (i.e. create/import/update) will exceed the maximum number of active credentials.
Credential consist of the following fields:

row.entry: user ID of the user who ownes of the credential

section.p: The Identity service supports credential type HP-IDM:access-key.
blob is a string-encoded JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) object with the following members:

row.entry: key algorithm. Value is one of (HmacSHA1, HmacSHA224, HmacSHA256).
key size, in bits, depending on the key algorithm. Minimum length is 64, and maximum length is 512. Default lenght is 240.
creation date. Format is ISO8601 date with micro second precision.
key status. Value is one of (active, inactive, expired, revoked, deleted, purged).
validity start date. Format is ISO8601 date with micro second precision.
validity end date. Format is ISO8601 date with micro second precision.

section.p: The Identity service supports the following key status:

row.entry: the give key is enabled and ready to use
the given key is disabled. The status must be updated to active before it can be used.
the given key has expired and cannot be used again
the given key has been revoked and cannot be used again
the given key has been deleted and cannot be used again
the given key has been permanently deleted

section.p:
Note:
Status expired, revoked, deleted, and purged are generated by the system and therefore immutable. They cannot be updated by the client.
By default, key validity is 10 years.

p.b: Differences Between Identity service and OpenStack Keystone

section.p: The Identity service does not support credential type ec2. Instead, it supports credential type HP-IDM:access-key with additional functionalities. Identity service access keys can be used to perform EC2 operations.

The Identity service allows maximum of three (3) active credentials at any given time. OpenStack Keystone has no limit on the number of credential a user can own. When listing credentials, you may use status query parameter to list the active credentials only. i.e. status=active. Otherwise, all credentials are returned. An HTTP code 403 will be returned if an operation (i.e. create/import/update) will exceed the maximum number of active credentials.

OpenStack Keystone supports optionally scoping a credential to a project by providing an project_id field. The Identity service does not support project scoping. If project_id is present during credential creation/import, it will be ignored.
The Identity service will enforce key length during import. If the given secret field is less than the minimum 64 bits or greater than the maximum of 512 bits, an HTTP code 400 will be returned.

The Identity service supports both credential creation and credential import while OpenStack Keystone only supports credential import. Credential creation is a mechanism to have the system to generate the credential on behalf of the user.

The Identity service supports self-service model for credential import and creation while OpenStack Keystone does not. For self-service model, user_id is optional. If absent, it will be default to the user ID associated with the caller`s token.

Note:
If a request is invalid (doesn't present the required headers or credentials), the request is rate limited by the source IP Address using same limits in the table above
If the limit is exceeded, the request will be failed with following message:

codeblock.codeph:
This request was rate-limited 429
Exceeded the number of requests that can be made to {PATH} per SECOND

section.p: In addition, a response header "RetryAfter" will be returned with value specifying the seconds after which a retry could be attempted

section.title: POST /credentials
section.p: This API can be utilized to either generate or import a credential for the user.

Caller must specify type. Optionally, caller may specify the secret and its required members in the blob to import a credential. If secret is absent, the system will generate a credential for the given user.
user_id is optional. If absent, it will be default to the user ID associated with the caller`s token.
secret must be the base64 encoding of the secret key. Secret key must be at least 64 bits and cannot exceed 512 bits. Otherwise, an HTTP code 400 will be returned.
if blob is absent, or it does not contain the secret member, a 240 bit secret will be generated and returned to the caller.

access is optional for credential creation. If access member is absent, one will be generated and returned to the caller. For credential import, access is required. If absent, an HTTP code 400 will be returned.
domain_id, access, key_length, status, valid_from, and valid_to are optional are optional for credential creation. However, status must be present whenever blob is present.
access, status, algorithm, and secret are required for credential import.
User may elect to have the system generate the key by supplying the key parameters, which are algorithm and key_length, in the blob field.
Supported algorithms are HmacSHA1, HmacSHA224, and HmacSHA256.

key_length must be at least 64 and no more than 512. If absent, it will be default to 240. On credential creation, if key_length is less than 64, credential will be generated with the default key length, which is 240.
There are no URL parameters for this operation.
See schema file for more details on the request and response data structure.

ul.li: type - String - credential type. Must be HP-IDM:access-key.
user_id (optional) - String - user ID of the user who owns the credential. If absent, it will be default to the caller`s user ID.
blob (Optional) - Blob - credential data

section.p: A valid token must be present in the X-Auth-Token HTTP header. Otherwise, an HTTP code 401 will be returned.
To create a HP-IDM:access-key credential with specific key length.

codeblock.codeph:
POST https://localhost:35357/v3/credentials HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-Type: application/xml X-Auth-Token: HPAuth_4e7b748be4b0600fec3d2a24
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?> <ns2:credential xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:ns2="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns3="http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0" id="KAKH35XE76JSE196XE4R" user_id="36968991407691" type="HP-IDM:access-key"> </ns2:credential>

HTTP/1.1 201 Created Content-Type: application/xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?> <ns2:credential xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:ns2="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns3="http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0" id="KAKH35XE76JSE196XE4R" user_id="36968991407691" type="HP-IDM:access-key" blob="{"access":"KAKH35XE76JSE196XE4R","secret":"Yi2KML9ODCflkyLPfJ8fgITsjOsmTSC5fXMqmLca","algorithm":"HmacSHA1","key_length":240,"created_on":"2012-09-20T19:51:28.000278Z","domain_id":"91641150119921","status":"active","valid_from":"2012-09-20T19:51:28.000000Z","valid_to":"2022-09-18T19:51:28.000000Z"}"> <ns2:links> <link rel="self" href="https://localhost:35357/v3/credentials/KAKH35XE76JSE196XE4R"/> </ns2:links> </ns2:credential>

This status code is returned when either authentication has not been performed, the provided X-Auth-Token is invalid or authentication credentials are invalid (including the user, project or domain having been disabled).

The result of the operation will exceed the maximum number of active credentials. This status code is also returned when the request is successfully authenticated but not authorized to perform the requested action.
The server encountered a problem while processing the request
The server is unavailable to process the request
The request was rate limited. Please refer to the Rate Limits section for various limits

codeblock.codeph: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?><unauthorized xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns2="http://www.hp.com/identity/api/ext/HP-IDM/v1.0" xmlns:ns3="http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0" xmlns:ns4="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" code="401"><message>UNAUTHORIZED</message><details>Invalid credentials</details></unauthorized>

section.title: GET /credentials
section.p: This API returns a list of selected user credentials.
This API supports pagination. See Pagination for more details.
The following query parameters applicable to all credentials types:

ul.li: page (Optional) - integer - page number
per_page (Optional) - integer - represents the maximum number of elements which will be returned in the request. Default is 100.
type (Optiona) - string - credential type. Select credentials matching the given type for the given user. Default is HP-IDM:access-key.
user_id (Optional) - string - user ID. Selects credentials with matching user ID. If not specified the user ID of the requester is used.
domain_id (Optional) - string - domain ID. Select credentials scoped to the given domain ID.
status (Optional) - string - Key status. Selects keys with matching status. Value is one of (active, inactive, expired, revoked, deleted, purged).

section.p: See schema file for more details on the request and response data structure.
A valid token must be presented in the X-Auth-Token HTTP header. Otherwise, an HTTP code 401 will be returned.
This call does not require a request body.

codeblock.codeph: GET /v3/credentials HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token: HPAuth_4e56db8d2cdce58d662fb351
GET /v3/credentials HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml X-Auth-Token: HPAuth_4e56db8d2cdce58d662fb351
GET /v3/credentials?page=2&per_page=10 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token: HPAuth_4e56db8d2cdce58d662fb351
GET /v3/credentials?user_id=DX4SRWF12&per_page=10 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token: HPAuth_4e56db8d2cdce58d662fb351
GET /v3/credentials?page=2&per_page=30 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml X-Auth-Token: HPAuth_4e56db8d2cdce58d662fb351
GET /v3/credentials?user_id=DX4SRWF12&per_page=10 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml X-Auth-Token: HPAuth_4e56db8d2cdce58d662fb351

HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?> <ns2:credentials xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:ns2="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns3="http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0"> <ns2:credential id="KAKH35XE76JSE196XE4R" user_id="36968991407691" type="HP-IDM:access-key" blob="{"access":"KAKH35XE76JSE196XE4R","secret":"Yi2KML9ODCflkyLPfJ8fgITsjOsmTSC5fXMqmLca","algorithm":"HmacSHA1","key_length":240,"created_on":"2012-09-20T19:51:28.000278Z","domain_id":"91641150119921","status":"active","valid_from":"2012-09-20T19:51:28.000000Z","valid_to":"2022-09-18T19:51:28.000000Z"}"> <ns2:links> <link rel="self" href="https://localhost:35357/v3/credentials/KAKH35XE76JSE196XE4R"/> </ns2:links> </ns2:credential> <ns2:credential id="31890119180371:KAKH35XE76JSE116XE4T" user_id="36968991407691" type="HP-IDM:access-key" blob="{"access":"31890119180371:KAKH35XE76JSE116XE4T","secret":"Yi2KML9ODCflkyLPfJ8fgITsjOsmTSC6fXMqmLcd","algorithm":"HmacSHA1","key_length":240,"created_on":"2012-10-01T23:39:50.000337Z","domain_id":"91641150119921","status":"active","valid_from":"2012-09-20T19:51:28.000000Z","valid_to":"2022-09-18T19:51:28.000000Z"}"> <ns2:links> <link rel="self" href="https://localhost:35357/v3/credentials/31890119180371:KAKH35XE76JSE116XE4T"/> </ns2:links> </ns2:credential> <ns2:links self="https://localhost:35357/v3/credentials?page=1&per_page=30?user_id=36968991407691&status=active" first="https://localhost:35357/v3/credentials?page=1&per_page=30?user_id=36968991407691&status=active" last="https://localhost:35357/v3/credentials?page=0&per_page=30?user_id=36968991407691&status=active"/> </ns2:credentials>

section.title: DELETE /credentials/{credential_id}
section.p: The credential_id url path parameter is required. The user_id query parameter is only required to delete a credential for a user other than the requester.

ul.li: credential_id (Required) - string - credential ID

section.p: The folowing query parameters are supported.

ul.li: user_id (Optional) - string - user ID of the credential owner. If not specified then defaults to user ID of the requester.

section.p: This call does not require a request body.
A valid token must be present in the X-Auth-Token HTTP header. Otherwise, an HTTP code 401 will be returned.
This call does not return a response body on success.

row.entry: Malformed request in URI or request body

This status code is returned when either authentication has not been performed, the provided X-Auth-Token is invalid or authentication credentials are invalid (including the user, project or domain having been disabled).
The request is successfully authenticated but not authorized to perform the requested action.
Specified credential ID or user ID not found
The server encountered a problem while processing the request
The server is unavailable to process the request
The request was rate limited. Please refer to the Rate Limits section for various limits

section.title: PATCH /credentials/{credential_id}
section.p: Only the following fields are updatable:

Note:
Status expired, revoked, deleted, and purged are generated by the system. They cannot be updated by the client.
The credential_id url path parameter is required.

ul.li: credential_id (Required) - string - credential ID.

section.p: See schema file for more details on the request and response data structure.

ul.li: status - string - credential status. One of the values (active, inactive).

section.p: A valid token must be present in the X-Auth-Token HTTP header. Otherwise, an HTTP code 401 will be returned.

PATCH https://localhost:35357/v3/credentials/KAKH35XE76JSE196XE4R HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-Type: application/xml X-Auth-Token: HPAuth_4e7bba89e4b0600fec3d2a3a

section.title: 3.4.2 Projects
section.p: Project is a collection of services, and associated with zero or more users who have access to these services via role references.
Note: If a request is invalid (doesn't present the required headers or credentials), the request is rate limited by the source IP Address using same limits in the table above.
If the limit is exceeded, the request will be failed with following message:

codeblock.codeph:
This request was rate-limited 429
Exceeded the number of requests that can be made to {PATH} per SECOND

section.p: In addition, a response header "RetryAfter" will be returned with value specifying the seconds after which a retry could be attempted.

section.title: GET /users/{user_id}/projects
section.p: This API returns a listing of all projects for which the provided user has a role assignment. If the user is not valid, an error is returned.
This API supports pagination. See Pagination for more details.
This API also supports optional name and enabled filters. Links returned for pagination will include whichever, if any, optional parameters were specified in the request.
The name and enabled filters can be used in any combination.

ul.li: page (Optional)} - integer - represents the page number within the overall response, valid values can be in the range from 1 to (total matched projects) / per_page. Maximum value can be 1000.
per_page (Optional) - integer - represents the maximum number of project elements which will be returned in the response. Default value is 100 and maximum can be 1000.
name (Optional) - string - name of the project to be returned.
enabled (Optional) - boolean - default behavior returns all projects with any status; this option can filter results to just enabled projects or just non-enabled projects.

section.p: See schema file for more details on the request and response data structure.
A valid token must be presented in the X-Auth-Token HTTP header. Otherwise, a 401 will be returned.
This call does not require a request body.

codeblock.codeph: GET /v3/users/10219525064128/projects HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token: HPAuth10_1aa07de4f94afd2cc8f236fdca256f2798cc360047c851e343e9aa60c2bacdb6
GET /v3/users/10219525064128/projects HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml X-Auth-Token: HPAuth10_1aa07de4f94afd2cc8f236fdca256f2798cc360047c851e343e9aa60c2bacdb6
GET /v3/users/10219525064128/projects?name=Test%20Project HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token: HPAuth10_1aa07de4f94afd2cc8f236fdca256f2798cc360047c851e343e9aa60c2bacdb6
GET /v3/users/10219525064128/projects?per_page=5&page=2 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token: HPAuth10_1aa07de4f94afd2cc8f236fdca256f2798cc360047c851e343e9aa60c2bacdb6

section.p: With the enabled flag to list enabled user's projects.

codeblock.codeph: GET /v3/users/10219525064128/projects?enabled=true HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token: HPAuth10_1aa07de4f94afd2cc8f236fdca256f2798cc360047c851e343e9aa60c2bacdb6

section.p: Returns list of matching projects as requested in 'Accept' header otherwise default response content type is 'application/json'
A list of projects in the specified format is returned.

section.title: GET /projects/{project_id}
section.p: This API returns a project for given project id. If id is not valid, an error is returned.
Project id is specified in URI.
See schema file for more details on the request and response data structure.
A valid token must be presented in the X-Auth-Token HTTP header. Otherwise, a 401 will be returned.
This call does not require a request body.

codeblock.codeph: GET https://region-a.geo-1.identity.hpcloudsvc.com:35357/v3/projects/10059524459397 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/json X-Auth-Token: HPAuth10_5b566ac7b191c1a38c7cd9fa3e90f4f983fe7225a0aab1845d2d62ac25977dc1

GET https://region-a.geo-1.identity.hpcloudsvc.com:35357/v3/projects/10059524459397 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml X-Auth-Token: HPAuth10_5b566ac7b191c1a38c7cd9fa3e90f4f983fe7225a0aab1845d2d62ac25977dc1

section.p: Returns project data as requested in 'Accept' header otherwise default response content type is 'application/json'
A project in the specified format is returned.

section.title: 3.4.3 Tokens
section.p: Tokens are used to represent user's authenticated identity with a time-based validity. Tokens data contain authorization information via roles related to a project or domain. A token is used to gain access to a HPE Helion Public Cloud Service offering. Tokens can be scoped to a project, domain or can be requested as unscoped. Unscoped token means that the token is essentially scoped to user's domain.
Tokens are generated by identity service after successful authentication. Token can be validated, re-scoped to another project or domain and/or can be revoked before its expiration.
Tokens can be requested by sending credentials as part of the request. The Identity service currently supports username/password and user acessskey credentials for v3.
AccessKey credentials are the preferred credentials for programmatic access for the following reasons:

ol.li: If the user changes password for username/password credential, accessKey credentials won't be affected
Client can have multiple acesss keys
Access keys can be managed. (ie) They can have different life span

section.p: Note: If a request is invalid (doesn't present the required headers or credentials), the request is rate limited by the source IP Address using same limits in the table above
If the limit is exceeded, the request will be failed with following message:

codeblock.codeph:
This request was rate-limited 429
Exceeded the number of requests that can be made to {PATH} per SECOND

section.p: In addition, a response header "RetryAfter" will be returned with value specifying the seconds after which a retry could be attempted

section.title: POST /v3/auth/tokens
section.p: This API is used to authenticate a user to be able to use a service. The result of a successful authentication is a token to be used with service requests. A credential is used to obtain a token. The Identity service currently supports username/password and user access key credentials. If authentication succeeds, the response will include an authentication token and service catalog ( list of available services for that user ). Tokens are valid for 12 hours. Issued tokens can become invalid in following cases:

ol.li: Either user or user's domain is disabled.
In case of scoped token, either scoped project or scoped project's domain is disabled.
If a user or domain is disabled, the token for the user or the users in the domain become invalid.

section.p: Besides using a username and password, another way to authenticate is using symmetric keys. Symmetric keys are user access key and secret key pairs provisioned for the user account. In this type of credential data, request body is expected to contain an access key and a secret key information belonging to the user. Once those keys are verified, a new token is created. In this type of authentication, the only change is in expected request body data (please see related example below). There is no difference in response format/content whether authentication is done using password credential data or access key credential data.

section.title: Service Catalog:
section.p: In case of un-scoped token request, the service catalog is going to include global active endpoints in its data. In case of scoped token request, the service catalog is going to include project specific endpoints as well as global active endpoints.

section.title: Scoped Tokens:
section.p: A token can be scoped either to a domain or to a project. ProjectId or DomainId/DomainName can be used to scope the token to project or domain respectively. ProjectName can also be used, in that case caller need to qualify the project using domain information, since project name is not globally unique. Project name is unique only in its domain

A project scoped token will also return service endpoints for other services associated with the project in question. An unscoped token will likely not contain service endpoints instead it will contain endpoints for global services such as Identity Service, Billing Service etc. Note that if project information is unknown, an unscoped token can be obtained and then a list of projects obtained. Project information can also be found in the Management Console.

section.title: Default Project Scoping:
section.p: In case a user has a defined default project defined on their account, scoping to that project is attempted if there is no scoping data provided in request. This scoping to default project is done provided project is in valid state and user has project specific role assignments. In the case a default project scoping cannot be achieved, then instead of returning errror, unscoped token is returned.
See examples below. If input data format is not correct in request body, then bad request error is returned with http status code 400.
See schema file for more details on the request and response data structure.
Authenticate using userid/password credential for an unscoped token. Also for this request/response no default project is defined for that userId
Authenticate using username/password credential for an unscoped token. User is qualified using domain name.
Authenticate using username/password credential for an unscoped token. User is qualified using domain id.
Authenticate using username/password credential scoped to a project using Project ID.
Authenticate using password credential, scoped to a project using project name. Project name is qualified using domain id.
Authenticate using password credential, scoped to a domain using domain name.
Authenticate using password credential, scoped to a doamin using domain id.
Authenticate using Access Key credential scoped to a project using Project ID.
Authenticate using password credential for a unscoped token.

codeblock.codeph: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <auth xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <identity> <methods> <method>password</method> </methods> <password> <user name="haneeftest" password="haneeftest"/> </password> </identity> </auth>

section.p: Authenticate using password credential for a project unscoped token.

codeblock.codeph: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <auth xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <identity> <methods> <method>password</method> </methods> <password> <user name="haneeftest" password="haneeftest"/> </password> </identity> <scope> <project name="HPCSDeomonDomain_DevProject"> <domain name="HPCSDemonDomain"/> </project> </scope> </auth>

section.p: Authenticate using access key credential domain scoped

codeblock.codeph: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <auth xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <identity> <methods> <method>accessKey</method> </methods> <accessKey accessKey="quyNVz7gMtpG9QsLz0DUrqGocYbr5X+KGbkJsqzs" secretKey="VCAVE3Y6RL9K8ADVKMY5"/> </identity> <scope> <domain name="HPCSDeomonDomain"> </domain> </scope> </auth>

row.entry: Malformed request in URI or request body.

This status code is returned when either authentication has not been performed, the provided X-Auth-Token is invalid or authentication credentials are invalid (including the user, project or domain having been disabled).
This status code is returned when the request is successfully authenticated but not authorized to perform the requested action.
The server encountered a problem while processing the request.
The request was rate limited. Please refer to the Rate Limits section for various limits.

codeblock.codeph: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <error xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" code="404" message=" Authentication Method is required" title=" Authentication Method is required"> <details>Supported methods are [password, token, accessKey]</details> </error>

b.i: Authenticate with Username/Password and Project ID

codeblock.codeph: curl {BaseUri}/v3/auth/tokens -s -i -k -X POST -H 'Content-type:application/json' -H 'Accept:application/json' -d '{"auth":{"identity":{"methods": ["password"],"password":{"user":{"name":"{username}","password":"{password}"}}},"scope":{"project":{"id":"{project_id}"}}}}'

b.i: Authenticate with Access Keys and Project ID

codeblock.codeph: curl {BaseURI}/v3/auth/tokens -s -i -k -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"auth":{"identity":{"methods":["accessKey"],"accessKey":{"accessKey":"{access_key}","secretKey":"{secret_key}"}},"scope":{"project":{"id":"{project_id}"}}}}'

section.title: POST /v3/auth/tokens
section.p: This API provides the ability to re-scope a valid token with another project. An existing unexpired token, regardless of its currently scoped or not, can be scoped to another project as long as the user has valid association with that project.
Re-scoping of token can be done from

ul.li: Unscoped token to a scoped token for specific project
Scoped token from one project to another project
Scoped token to unscoped token (with no projectId and projectName specified in request). Re-scoping of token does not alter the token expiration time. Rescoping the token returns different token.

section.title: Service Catalog:
section.p: In case of un-scoped token request, the service catalog is going to include global active endpoint templates as endpoints in its data. In case of scoped token request, the service catalog is going to include project specific endpoints as well as global active endpoint templates as endpoints.
See schema file for more details on the request and response data structure.

row.entry: Malformed request in URI or request body.

This status code is returned when either authentication has not been performed, the provided X-Auth-Token is invalid or authentication credentials are invalid (including the user, project or domain having been disabled). Invalid token returns 401
This status code is returned when the request is successfully authenticated but not authorized to perform the requested action.
The server encountered a problem while processing the request.
The server is unavailable to process the request.
The request was rate limited. Please refer to the Rate Limits section for various limits.

codeblock.codeph: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <error code="401" message="Invalid Token" title="UNAUTHORIZED" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <details> Invalid token </details> </error>

curl -k -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"auth": {"identity": {"methods": ["token"],"token": { "id": "HPAuth_a6f32cefceb798cedd3183c71c07a3d169c8ad613e0c951ae5f426c015dd3210"}}}}' -X POST https://region-a.geo-1.identity.hpcloudsvc.com:35357/v3/auth/tokens

section.title: DELETE /v3/auth/tokens
section.p: This API is used to revoke an authentication token. This operation does not require a request body. Once a token has been revoked, attempts to validate the token will fail with a 404 (item not found) as the token no longer exists. Trying to revoke a non existing token, including one which has expired will also return a 401 (Unauthorized). Users revoke only their own tokens. Domain Admin can revoke their domain users token
This call does not require a request body.

row.entry: Malformed request in URI or request body.

This status code is returned when either authentication has not been performed, the provided X-Auth-Token is invalid or authentication credentials are invalid (including the user, project or domain having been disabled).
This status code is returned when the request is successfully authenticated but not authorized to perform the requested action.
The request was rate limited. Please refer to the Rate Limits section for various limits.

codeblock.codeph: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <error code="403" message="FORBIDDEN" title="FORBIDDEN" xmlns="http://docs.openstack.org/identity/api/v3" xmlns:ns2="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"> <details>Account is inactive</details> </error>
curl -k -X DELETE -H "X-Auth-Token:HPAuth_23423423424234" -H "X-Subject-Token: HPAuth_45345345345454534" https://hostname/v3/auth/tokens

section.p: Keystone doesn't require X-Auth-Token headers. HPE Helion keystone implementation requires X-Auth-Token header for authorization purpose.

section.title: 3.4.4 Versions
section.p: This API returns the Identity service version supported by HPE Helion Public Cloud. It also reports the status of each version.

row.entry: X-Auth-Token in request header or IP

section.p: Note: If a request is invalid (doesn't present the required headers or credentials), the request is rate limited by the source IP Address using same limits in the table above
If the limit is exceeded, the request will be failed with following message:

codeblock.codeph:
This request was rate-limited 429
Exceeded the number of requests that can be made to / per SECOND

section.p: In addition, a response header "RetryAfter" will be returned with value specifying the seconds after which a retry could be attempted

section.title: GET /
section.p: This call does not require a request body.

section.p: A list of supported versions of identity API and its current status are returned.
